availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Emery Whitaker (Mason County, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. New Hampshire native. Married to Corrilla Whitaker. Father of John L. Whitaker, Emery C. Whitaker, and Harlen P. Whitaker. Attorney and judge in Mason County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860. Partner with W. P. Conwell in a law firm until March 11, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 282.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 27A.
Maysville Weekly Bulletin, January 22, 1863, p. 3.
Find A Grave, "Emery Whitaker (1816-1898)," Memorial #52811055, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52811055 (accessed April 17, 2018).
